TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ServiceDescriptionImporter extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Exposes a means of generating client proxy classes for XML Web services.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The interface to an XML Web service is typically described by a Web Services Description Language (WSDL) file. For example, to obtain a WSDL description of a Web service using ASP.NET exposed at `http://localhost/service.asmx`, simply navigate to `http://localhost/service.asmx?WSDL`.
The ServiceDescriptionImporter class allows you to easily import the information contained in a WSDL description into a <xref:System.CodeDom.CodeCompileUnit?displayProperty=fullName> object. By adjusting the value of the <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionImporter.Style%2A> parameter, you can instruct a ServiceDescriptionImporter instance either to generate a client proxy class that provides the functionality of the Web service by transparently calling it or to generate an abstract class that encapsulates the functionality of the Web service without implementing it.
The code in the resulting <xref:System.CodeDom.CodeCompileUnit> object can then either be called directly or exported in the language of your choice.
## Examples The following example illustrates the use of the ServiceDescriptionImporter class to generate proxy client code that calls an XML Web service described by a WSDL file.
[!code-cs[WebServices_Description_Importer#0](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.services.de_50_1.cs)] [!code-cpp[WebServices_Description_Importer#0](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.web.services.de_50_1.cpp)]

MemberSignature.Value: public void AddServiceDescription (System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescription serviceDescription, string appSettingUrlKey, string appSettingBaseUrl);

.method public hidebysig instance void AddServiceDescription(class System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescription serviceDescription, string appSettingUrlKey, string appSettingBaseUrl) cil managed

Docs.param: The instance to add to the collection

Sets the initial value of the property of the proxy class to be generated from the instance represented by the `serviceDescription` parameter. Specifies that it should be generated from the web.config file's section.

Sets the initial value of the property of the proxy class to be generated from the instance represented by the `serviceDescription` parameter. Specifies that it should be constructed from a combination of the value of this parameter and the URL specified by the attribute in the WSDL document.
Docs.summary: Adds the specified to the collection of <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionImporter.ServiceDescriptions%2A> values to be imported.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this method to add <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescription> instances to the collection that is to be imported when the <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionImporter.Import%2A> method is called.
The two string parameters, `appSettingUrlKey` and `appSettingBaseUrl`, specify how to construct the `Url` property of the XML Web service proxy that is to be generated from the imported <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescription> value. The `appSettingUrlKey` parameter specifies that the `Url` property should be read out of the web.config file's `<appsettings>` section by using the parameter value as the configuration key. If the `appSettingUrlKey` parameter is `null` or an empty string, the initial value is determined by the `location` attribute in the Web Services Description Language (WSDL) document. If the value of <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionImporter.Style%2A> is `Server`, an error is raised if you attempt to set the value of the `appSettingUrlKey` parameter.
The `appSettingBaseUrl` parameter specifies that the initial value for the `Url` property should be constructed from a combination of this parameter value and the URL specified by the `location` attribute in the WSDL document. The `appSettingUrlKey` parameter must also be specified. The `Url` property is constructed by combining a relative URL (constructed from the `appSettingBaseUrl` parameter and the WSDL-specified URL) with the URL loaded from the web.config file. If this parameter is `null` or an empty string, the URL is constructed entirely from the value in the web.config file.
## Examples The following example illustrates the use of the AddServiceDescription method when using the <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionImporter> class.
[!code-cs[WebServices_Description_Importer#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/49ce8ede-cef3-4d48-9b54-_1.cs)] [!code-cpp[WebServices_Description_Importer#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/49ce8ede-cef3-4d48-9b54-_1.cpp)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets various options for code generation.
Docs.value: A member or combination of members of the enumeration.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The CodeGenerationOptions property allows you to specify various options used when the <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionImporter.Import%2A> method is called to generate code. For example, you can specify whether simple types described in the WSDL are generated as value types or <xref:System.Data.SqlTypes> namespace types, and whether they are generated as properties or fields.
## Examples The following example illustrates the use of the CodeGenerationOptions property.
[!code-cs[WebServices_Description_Importer#4](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/e20dd6e2-9cf6-4c59-bc76-_1.cs)] [!code-cpp[WebServices_Description_Importer#4](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/e20dd6e2-9cf6-4c59-bc76-_1.cpp)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the code generator used by the service description importer.
Docs.value: The interface used by the service description importer to generate proxy code.

MemberSignature.Value: public static System.Collections.Specialized.StringCollection GenerateWebReferences (System.Web.Services.Description.WebReferenceCollection webReferences, System.CodeDom.Compiler.CodeDomProvider codeProvider, System.CodeDom.CodeCompileUnit codeCompileUnit, System.Web.Services.Description.WebReferenceOptions options);

.method public static hidebysig class System.Collections.Specialized.StringCollection GenerateWebReferences(class System.Web.Services.Description.WebReferenceCollection webReferences, class System.CodeDom.Compiler.CodeDomProvider codeProvider, class System.CodeDom.CodeCompileUnit codeCompileUnit, class System.Web.Services.Description.WebReferenceOptions options) cil managed

Docs.param: A of Web references to compile.
A that specifies the code provider.
A that specifies the unit into which code is compiled.
A that specifies code generation options.
Docs.summary: Compiles a collection of Web references to produce a client proxy or a server stub.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The services description document collection in each <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.WebReference> member of the `webReferences` collection should contain only <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescription> and <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchema> objects. This method is unable to interpret <xref:System.Web.Services.Discovery.DiscoveryDocument> objects.
If any of the XML Web service methods in the `webReferences` collection share custom parameter or return types, those types are also shared among the proxy methods generated. This is an important advantage over the situation in which each proxy is compiled separately, because in that case such types do not interoperate.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance valuetype System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionImportWarnings Import(class System.CodeDom.CodeNamespace codeNamespace, class System.CodeDom.CodeCompileUnit codeCompileUnit) cil managed

Docs.param: The namespace into which the <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionImporter.ServiceDescriptions%2A> values are imported.
The instance in which the code that represents the <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionImporter.ServiceDescriptions%2A> value is generated.
Docs.summary: Imports the specified <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionImporter.ServiceDescriptions%2A> values, that generates code as specified by the <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionImporter.Style%2A> property.
Docs.returns: A value that describes any error that occurred; or 0 if no error occurred.

remarks.format:
## Remarks After you have specified the <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionImporter.ServiceDescriptions%2A> values to import and the <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionImporter.Style%2A> property of the code to generate, call the <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.Import> method to initiate code generation.
## Examples The following example illustrates the use of the <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.Import> method.
[!code-cs[WebServices_Description_Importer#5](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/73b706ec-3da0-46d2-87f5-_1.cs)] [!code-cpp[WebServices_Description_Importer#5](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/73b706ec-3da0-46d2-87f5-_1.cpp)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the protocol used to access the described XML Web services.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.String> that contains the case-insensitive name of the protocol to be imported.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The allowed values of this property are:
- "Soap"
- "Soap12"
- "HttpPost"
- "HttpGet"
- "HttpSoap"
The default value is "Soap", which indicates the SOAP 1.1 standard.
## Examples The following example illustrates the use of the ProtocolName property when using the <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionImporter> class.
[!code-cs[WebServices_Description_Importer#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.services.de_24_1.cs)] [!code-cpp[WebServices_Description_Importer#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/p-system.web.services.de_24_1.cpp)]

Docs.summary: Gets the used by the <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionImporter.ServiceDescriptions%2A> property.
Docs.value: An object that contains the XML schemas used by the instances in the <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionImporter.ServiceDescriptions%2A> collection.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example illustrates the use of the Schemas property.
[!code-cs[WebServices_Description_Importer#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.services.de_60_1.cs)] [!code-cpp[WebServices_Description_Importer#2](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/p-system.web.services.de_60_1.cpp)]

Docs.summary: Gets the collection of instances to be imported.
Docs.value: A instance that contains the instances slated to be imported by the instance.

remarks.format:
## Remarks As with any collection that forms a read-only property, members can be added to the collection, removed from the collection, or modified using the methods exposed by the collection. You can also use the <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionImporter.AddServiceDescription%2A> method to add members to this collection.
## Examples The following example illustrates the use of the ServiceDescriptions property.
[!code-cs[WebServices_Description_Importer#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/5d2607b7-babd-4802-b778-_1.cs)] [!code-cpp[WebServices_Description_Importer#2](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/5d2607b7-babd-4802-b778-_1.cpp)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines the style of code (client or server) that is generated when the <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionImporter.ServiceDescriptions%2A> values are imported.
Docs.value: One of the values. The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the Style property is set to <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionImportStyle>, the <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionImporter> generates client proxy classes that provide the functionality of the described Web services by calling them.
If the Style property is set to <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionImportStyle>, the <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionImporter> instance generates abstract classes that represent the functionality of the described XML Web services without implementing them. You can then implement them by writing classes that inherit from these abstract classes and implement the relevant methods.
## Examples The following example illustrates the use of the Style property.
[!code-cs[WebServices_Description_Importer#3](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.services.de_65_1.cs)] [!code-cpp[WebServices_Description_Importer#3](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/p-system.web.services.de_65_1.cpp)]
